column5: The cold front moved thru here about 5 this morning with strong winds, rain and lotsa lightening. Power went out at 5:15 for about an hour but we're good now although the radio says there's still many folks without hydro.  Sure is nice to finally see some rain though, it's been along time since we had any.  I planned  a musky trip to Upper Buck today but their calling for more lightening  so I'll put it off until tomorrow.

We sure could use some down here.   Around 90+ for most of this week and no rain in sight for us.  Grass is brown and just crunches when you walk on it.  Farmers are really having a rough time right now.
Ya, it was sure nice to see that this morning Lew (we had no lightening, but it did rain).  Hopefully we'll get enough to give the grass a bit of color again!!
dont like rain lolz it ruin my fishing
Rained here a bit over night, just enough to double the humidity this morning
Not much rain up here at all.
WISH it would rain here in Toronto to relieve some of this humidity, the week is looking like it's going to feel around 40 everyday.
Got about 10 drops here this morning.........
Rained for 20 mins this morning, exaclty from the time I left for my run until I returned.
Sprinkled on University Ave early this morning. That made it even worse out there, didn't think I was gonna make it back from a walk to Bay/Richmond to raz the lads.

TONS of lightning here last night. Lots of rain, too. I love the rain, but I'll admit, it was kinda worrisome being out in it, up on a big hit, trying to get lightning photos. lol  I love fishing in the rain, but when there's lightning, no thanks.
Well we have the thunder and lightning I am sure will get just enough rain to make the humidity raise about 10 degrees it sure is hot here nothing like Saskatchewan there is is so nice and dry.
If ya get some send some over...we have a few forest fires this year!
Dark skies, but no rain. Good thing I decided to run the irrigation this morning.  So hot out I can hear the tomatoes ripening.
